Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Crap \Crap\ (kr[a^]p), n. 1. In the game of craps, a first throw of the dice in which the total is two, three, or twelve, in which case the caster loses. Also called {craps}. [Webster 1913 Suppl. +PJC]
2. same as {excrement} and {feces}. [vulgar]
Syn: shit. [PJC]
3. nonsense; balderdash; bullshit; -- also used as an expletive. [vulgar]
Syn: bullshit. [PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Crap \Crap\ (kr[a^]p), v. 1. to defecate. Same as {take a crap}. [vulgar] [PJC]

crap n 1: obscene terms for feces [syn: {dirt}, {shit}, {shite}, {poop}, {turd}] 2: obscene words for unacceptable behavior; "I put up with a lot of bullshit from that jerk"; "what he said was mostly bull" [syn: {bullshit}, {bull}, {Irish bull}, {horseshit}, {shit}, {dogshit}] v : have a bowel movement; "The dog had made in the flower beds" [syn: {stool}, {defecate}, {shit}, {take a shit}, {take a crap}, {ca-ca}, {make}] [also: {crapping}, {crapped}]
